Package jetbrains.exodus.backup

Class BackupStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • jetbrains.exodus.backup.BackupStrategy
  • public abstract class BackupStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes how a backup file should be cooked by BackupBean. Only listed by getContents() and accepted by acceptFile(VirtualFileDescriptor) files are put into backup file with defined pre- (beforeBackup()) and postprocessing (afterBackup()).
    See Also:
    Backupable, BackupBean

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  BackupStrategy.FileDescriptor
      Descriptor of a file to be put into backup file.

    • Method Detail

      • beforeBackup

        public void beforeBackup()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Backup pre-processing procedure. E.g., Environment turns database GC off before backup.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something went wrong

      • getContents

        public java.lang.Iterable<VirtualFileDescriptor> getContents()

      • listFiles

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.Iterable<BackupStrategy.FileDescriptor> listFiles()
        Deprecated.

      • afterBackup

        public void afterBackup()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Backup postprocessing procedure. E.g., Environment turns database GC on after backup.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something went wrong

      • isInterrupted

        public boolean isInterrupted()
        Can be used to interrupt backup process. After each processed file, BackupBean checks if backup procedure should be interrupted.
        Returns:
        true if backup should be interrupted.

      • onError

        public void onError​(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Override this method to define custom exception handling.
        Parameters:
        t - throwable thrown during backup.

      • acceptFile

        public long acceptFile​(@NotNull
                       @NotNull VirtualFileDescriptor file)
        Parameters:
        file - file to be backed up.
        Returns:
        the length of specified file that should be put into backup, minimum is taken between the actual file size and the value returned. If the method returns a less than one value the file won't be put into backup.

      • acceptFile

        @Deprecated
public long acceptFile​(@NotNull
                       @NotNull java.io.File file)
        Deprecated.
        Parameters:
        file - file to be backed up.
        Returns:
        ignored by API
        See Also:
        acceptFile(VirtualFileDescriptor)

        public boolean isEncrypted()
